IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO ENCOURAGE AND EXPAND MASONIC PHILANTHROPY TO CHARITABLE, EDUCATIONAL, AND SCIENTIFIC PROGRAMS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE KANSAS MASONIC FOUNDATION BENEFITS KANSANS BY FUNDING CHARITABLE ORGANIZATIONS.
IRS990.Desc: ANNUAL HIGH SCHOOOL BAND CAMP STUDENTS ARE SPONSORED BY LOCAL LODGES ACROSS KANSAS AND COORDINATED BY THE KANSAS SHRINE BOWL. LOCAL LODGES PAY A FEE FORE EACH STUDENT (NO COST TO THE STUDENT). THE BAND CAMP PROGRAM HAS BEEN RECOGNIZED AND HAS BEEN COPIED BY OTHER STATES. THE ADMINISTRATION OF THE CAMP IS NOW HANDLED BY THE KANSAS SHRINE BOWL AND THE KANSAS MASONIC FOUNDATION SUPPORTS THE CAMP THROUGH A GRANT TO THE KANSAS SHRINE BOWL TO HELP DEFRAY THE COSTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: ASSIST THOSE IN NEED BY PROVIDING SCHOLARSHIPS. THE GRANTS RELATED TO SCHOLARSHIPS WERE PAID TO INDIVIDUALS AND WERE INCLUDED IN THE AUDITED PROGRAM EXPENSE OF CONTRIBUTIONS, GRANTS, AND SCHOLARSHIPS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: OTHER CHARITABLE ACTIVITIES CONSISTENT WITH THE KANSAS MASONIC FOUNDATION'S MISSION TO ENCOURAGE AND EXPAND MASONIC PHILANTHROPY TO CHARITABLE, EDUCATIONAL AND SCIENTIFIC PROGRAMS. THE GRANTS RELATED TO CHARITABLE, EDUCATIONAL, AND SCIENTIFIC PROGRAMS ARE PAID TO ORGANIZATIONS AND INCLUDED IN THE AUDITED PROGRAM EXPENSE OF 50TH ANNIVERSARY PAYMENTS TO UNIVERSITIES AND CONTRIBUTIONS, GRANTS, AND SCHOLARSHIPS LESS THE SCHOLARSHIPS PAID TO INDIVIDUALS NOTED ABOVE IN 4B.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 2, PART IV, LINE 2B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THESE FUNDS REPRESENT FUNDS HELD AND INVESTED BY KANSAS MASONIC FOUNDATION ON BEHALF OF OTHER ORGANIZATIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 4, PART XI, LINE 2D
SCHEDULE D, PAGE 4, PART XII, LINE 2D

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PART II GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE TO DOMESTIC ORGANIZATIONS AND DOMESTIC GOVERNEMENTS ARE A COMBINATION OF THE AUDITED PROGRAM SERVICES EXPENSE FOR 50TH ANNIVERSARY PAYMENTS TO UNIVERSITIES, BAND, AND CONTRIBUTIONS, GRANTS, AND SCHOLARSHIPS LESS THE SCHOLARSHIPS PAID TO INDIVIDUALS REPORTED IN PART III. PART III GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO DOMESTIC INDIVIDUALS CONSIST OF SCHOLARSHIPS PAID TO INDIVIDUALS AND ARE INCLUDED IN THE AUDITED PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSE FOR CONTRIBUTIONS, GRANTS, AND SCHOLARSHIPS.
FORM 990 IS COMPLETED BY AN INDEPENDENT CPA. THE ACCOUNTING MANAGER AND EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR REVIEW FORM 990 PRIOR TO FILING. FORM 990 IS ALSO MADE AVAILABLE TO THE BOARD PRIOR TO FILING.
THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY MAINTAINED BY THE KANSAS MASONIC FOUNDATION, INC. REQUIRES BOARD MEMBERS AND EMPLOYEES TO REPORT ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST TO THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR.

THE PRESIDENT SHALL APPOINT FROM AMONG THE BOARD A HUMAN RESOURCES COMMITTEE WHICH SHALL REVIEW THE EVALUATIONS PRESENTED BY THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR FOR ALL EMPLOYEES, AND THEN SHALL PRESENT TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AT THE ANNUAL MEETING. THE COMMITTEE SHALL MAKE SURE THE PERSONNEL POLICY IS REVIEWED AND UPDATED AS NECESSARY. THE COMMITTEE SHALL PRESENT SALARY AND PROMOTION ADJUSTMENTS MADE BY THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AT THE ANNUAL MEETING. THE COMMITTEE SHALL ADVISE THE BOARD ON PERSONNEL GREIVANCE RESOLUTIONS AND OTHER SIGNIFICANT HUMAN RESOURCES ISSUES. ALL EVALUATIONS SHALL BE ON FILE BY THE END OF THE FISCAL YEAR. ALL RECOMMENDATIONS FOR PAY INCREASES SHALL BE ON FILE AFTER THE END OF THE FISCAL YEAR, MARCH 31.

THE PRESIDENT SHALL APPOINT FROM AMONG THE BOARD A HUMAN RESOURCES COMMITTEE WHICH SHALL REVIEW THE EVALUATIONS PRESENTED BY THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR FOR ALL EMPLOYEES, AND THEN SHALL PRESENT TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AT THE ANNUAL MEETING. THE COMMITTEE SHALL MAKE SURE THE PERSONNEL POLICY IS REVIEWED AND UPDATED AS NECESSARY. THE COMMITTEE SHALL PRESENT SALARY AND PROMOTION ADJUSTMENTS MADE BY THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AT THE ANNUAL MEETING. THE COMMITTEE SHALL ADVISE THE BOARD ON PERSONNEL GREIVANCE RESOLUTIONS AND OTHER SIGNIFICANT HUMAN RESOURCES ISSUES. ALL EVALUATIONS SHALL BE ON FILE BY THE END OF THE FISCAL YEAR. ALL RECOMMENDATIONS FOR PAY INCREASES SHALL BE ON FILE AFTER THE END OF THE FISCAL YEAR, MARCH 31.
GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
